channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report X-2023110703
item.description:
Report X-2023110703

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: RENSSELAER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Around 7:30 AM the driver noticed a strong odor coming from the package, they brought it to QA and it was placed in the hazmat cage to be processed. DescribePack: The item was tightly wrapped using a plastic bag, absorbent pads, and zip ties, it kept the liquid from leaking outside of the box. The odor was able to get out which is what alerted us to the damage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a sealed container

item.title: Report X-2023110981
item.description:
Report X-2023110981

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: PLATTSBURGH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was presented leaking and brought to QA attention. Immediately after attention was drawn the SDS binder was pulled to identify what had spilled. DPR and ISF were completed swiftly before bagging and moving to adequate position. DescribePack: Loosened caps caused liquid inside to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Damaged package report and Improper Shipping Form was completed swiftly; Package was bagged in chemical resistant bag and moved to HazMat cage to await disposition.

item.title: Report E-2023120005
item.description:
Report E-2023120005

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: EAST SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit, a 330-gallon tote containing approximately 295-gallons of Ethyl Thioglycolate (UN2810) was crushed and punctured as a result of improper loading. This resulted in 4-gallons of product spilling onto the trailer floor and the asphalt below. A Contractor cleaned-up the release and performed a tote transfer. The damaged tote was cut-up and containerized into two UN-rated shipping containers for disposal. No storm drains, water ways, or soil were impacted by the release.

item.title: Report X-2023110906
item.description:
Report X-2023110906

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: HOLBROOK
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was dry. When the box was moved on the van, the driver heard glass moving around and saw some pieces of glass fall out of the box. The driver immediately put the box into a plastic container and call the QA team. The box was removed from the vehicle. A manager notified. Everyone noticed the box was 100% dry but it sounded like broken glass. Upon inspection, saw 2 of the glass gallon containers were broken. No liquid inside. The cardboard did look like it had been wet at one time and dried. The small pieces of glass inside the van was swept up and put into the plastic container. The plastic container with the hazmat inside was brought to the Hazmat cage. DescribePack: The glass of two of the four bottles inside had broken. Since the box was already dry and had no damage to it I can not state exactly what had happened. I do know there was 3 inches of empty space on the top of the box. This would cause the glass bottles to be able to move around during transit. The bottles, even though they had the paper molds on the bottom and on the top, the bottles could still move around inside the box. The two bottles that had broken broke in the center of the bottles. The top seemed to be okay and the very bottom glass was okay. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The methanol inside the broken bottles had already evaporated. The box was totally dry. To minimize any more broken bottles, the box was but inside a plastic bin and transported to the hazmat cage. The small pieces of broken glass that had fallen out of the box was swept up and placed inside the plastic container.

DescribePack: One of the jugs had a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I put it in a hazmat bag and brought it over to our hazmat cage on a cart.

item.title: Report X-2023110658
item.description:
Report X-2023110658

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: LONG ISLAND CITY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat package was being unloaded and during transport it slipped and fell against the pavement very hard resulting in a crack on the bottom of the pail. The crack caused a spill of the containing substance. Kitty litter was used to contain the spill and further accident. DescribePack: There was a line crack on the base of the hazmat pail about 3" in diameter. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Kitty litter. a solvent agent, was used to contain the spill.
